p.s: Emended description of the genus Rheinheimera
Rheinheimera (Rhein.hei′me.ra. N.L. n. Rheinheimera named after the German marine microbiologist Gerhard Rheinheimer, in recognition of his work on marine and estuarine bacteria).
The description of the genus Rheinheimera is as given by Brettar et al. (2002) but with the following changes.
Of freshwater, estuarine or marine origin.
NaCl supports growth, except in the case of one species, but strains are not tolerant of high salinities (>6 %).
